title: Buy HDFC Bank; target of Rs 1,850: ICICI Securities
description: ICICI Securities is bullish on HDFC Bank has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1,850 in its research report dated April 21, 2024.

title: Buy Tejas Networks; target of Rs 1100: Emkay Global Financial
description: Emkay Global Financial is bullish on Tejas Networks has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1100 in its research report dated April 23, 2024.

title: Buy Bajaj Finance; target of Rs 9000: Emkay Global Financial
description: Emkay Global Financial is bullish on Bajaj Finance has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 9000 in its research report dated April 23, 2024.

title: Buy Bajaj Finance; target of Rs 9000: Emkay Global Financial
description: Emkay Global Financial is bullish on Bajaj Finance has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 9000 in its research report dated April 23, 2024.

title: Reduce Persistent Systems; target of Rs 3700: Emkay Global Financial
description: Emkay Global Financial recommended reduce rating on Persistent Systems with a target price of Rs 3700 in its research report dated April 22, 2024.

title: Reduce Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail; target of Rs 230: Emkay Global Financial
description: Emkay Global Financial recommended reduce rating on Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail with a target price of Rs 230 in its research report dated April 23, 2024.

title: Reduce Wipro; target of Rs 410: ICICI Securities
description: ICICI Securities is bullish on Wipro has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 410 in its research report dated April 21, 2024.

title: Buy HDFC Life Insurance Company; target of Rs 739: ICICI Securities
description: ICICI Securities is bullish on HDFC Life Insurance Company has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 739 in its research report dated April 21, 2024.

title: Buy Patel Engineering; target of Rs 80: ICICI Direct
description: ICICI Direct is bullish on Patel Engineering recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 80 in its research report dated April 22, 2024.

title: Accumulate Infosys; target of Rs 1531: KR Choksey
description: KR Choksey recommended Accumulate rating on Infosys with a target price of Rs 1531 in its research report dated April 22, 2024.

title: Buy Jindal Drilling and Industries; target of Rs 960: Anand Rathi
description: Anand Rathi is bullish on Jindal Drilling and Industries has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 960 in its research report dated April 22, 2024.

title: Buy Navneet Education; target of Rs 182: Prabhudas Lilladher
description: Prabhudas Lilladher is bullish on Navneet Education has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 182 in its research report dated April 22, 2024.

title: Sell Indus Tower; target of Rs 260: ICICI Securities
description: ICICI Securities is bearish on Indus Tower has recommended sell rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 260 in its research report dated April 20, 2024.

title: Buy City Union Bank; target of Rs 170: ICICI Securities
description: ICICI Securities is bullish on City Union Bank has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 170 in its research report dated April 21, 2024.

title: Buy Hatsun Agro Products; target of Rs 1190: ICICI Securities
description: ICICI Securities is bullish on Hatsun Agro Products recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1190 in its research report dated April 23, 2024.

title: ICICI Prudential AMC's Rs 10,700 crore IPO to open next week
description: ICICI Prudential AMC, India’s largest active asset manager, will launch its ₹10,700 crore IPO next week, fully via OFS. Valued around ₹1.07 lakh crore, the issue includes Prudential selling a 10% stake. With strong market share and profit growth, the AMC recently secured Sebi approval.

title: FPIs withdraw Rs 13,121 cr in just 4 days; outflow reaches Rs 1.56 lakh cr in 2025
description: Foreign investors have pulled out Rs 13,121 crore (USD 1.46 billion) from Indian equities in the first four days of December, taking the total outflow for 2025 to Rs 1.56 lakh crore (USD 17.8 billion), data from NSDL showed on Thursday.

title: British American Tobacco plans to offload up to 15.3% stake in ITC Hotels via block deal
description: BAT announced that its wholly-owned subsidiaries, Tobacco Manufacturers (India) Limited, Myddleton Investment Company Limited and Rothmans International Enterprises Limited, intend to sell the issued ordinary share capital in ITC Hotels via block deals.

title: Gold outlook 2026 hinges on global uncertainty as WGC warns of sharp swings
description: Gold’s 2026 trajectory will depend on geo-economic uncertainty, with prices likely rangebound unless growth slows or risks rise. Lower rates and a weaker dollar may lift gold, while strong US growth could push it lower. Central bank demand and diversification needs remain key drivers.

title: India bonds slip on muddled policy bets; benchmark up on liquidity hopes
description: Indian government bonds ended largely unchanged on Thursday as uncertainty over the fate of the key repo rate the following day discouraged traders, even as the benchmark bond rose, with traders hopeful of liquidity infusion from the central bank.

title: Asian Paints, Vedanta and 3 other stocks hit 52-week highs; gains up to 18% in a month
description: Five BSE500 stocks — including Asian Paints, Vedanta and Hero MotoCorp — hit fresh 52-week highs on Thursday, extending up to 18% gains over the past month amid strong market momentum.

title: Gainers & Losers: HindustanCopper, Indigo among 6 stocks that grabbed eyeballs on Thursday
description: Six stocks — including Hindustan Copper, IndiGo, and Ola — stood out on Thursday as markets snapped a four-day rally, with sharp moves driven by corporate updates, rupee-led IT gains, and company-specific pressures.

title: Rupee recovers from record low level, rises 19 paise to close at 89.96/USD
description: The rupee rebounded from its all-time low levels and appreciated by 19 paise to close at 89.96 against the US dollar on Thursday, on softness in the US dollar index and on reports of the Reserve Bank of India's supposed intervention.

title: Smartworks leases 1.68 lakh sq ft office space to a global IT services firm in Kolkata
description: Realty firm Smartworks Coworking Spaces Ltd has provided on lease around 1.68 lakh sq ft office spaces in Kolkata to a global IT services firm.

title: Market Wrap: Sensex adds 158 pts, Nifty above 26,000 as D-St snaps 4-day losing run
description: Indian stocks snapped a four-day slide on Thursday, with the Sensex and Nifty closing higher, primarily driven by IT shares. This advance occurred ahead of the Reserve Bank of India's policy decision, with IT stocks benefiting from a softer rupee and expectations of a U.S. rate cut. Financials, however, acted as a drag on the broader market.

title: Indigo's problems on runway now extend to its charts. Should you buy, sell or hold?
description: IndiGo shares slid further after major flight disruptions, with technical indicators signalling persistent weakness. Analysts advise avoiding or selling the stock as it trades below key levels, facing resistance near ₹5,700 and risks of deeper downside despite upcoming Sensex inclusion.

title: Rupee at 90+: Why IT becomes a safe haven and where the real risks still hide
description: Sowilo Investment Managers’ Sandip Agarwal says the recent IT stock rally driven by rupee depreciation is more of a temporary tailwind than a structural upswing. He expects limited earnings momentum for large IT firms but sees long-term opportunity in ER&D players, platform businesses, capital-market plays and select manufacturing names as mid- and small-cap earnings remain fundamentally stronger.

title: Women's participation in crypto doubles YoY with Bitcoin, Ethereum, Dogecoin, Solana among top holdings: CoinDCX’s 2025 Annual Report
description: CoinDCX reports a sharp rise in women investors, broader token diversification, and strong participation from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities. Ethereum volumes surged across metros, signalling a shift toward research-led, long-term investing and deeper institutional adoption ahead of 2026.

title: Jio Platforms IPO: Reliance said to start work on draft prospectus for India’s biggest IPO
description: Reliance Industries has begun drafting a prospectus for Jio Platforms' initial public offering, aiming to make it India's largest ever. The company is in preliminary talks with banks, with the formal process expected after new IPO rules are implemented. This move could see Jio raise billions, potentially valuing it at up to $170 billion.

title: Fed rate-cut uncertainty no threat to India; domestic cyclicals set to outperform: Anish Tawakley
description: ICICI Prudential AMC’s Co-CIO (Equity), Anish Tawakley, says a Fed rate cut has limited economic impact on India and any negative market reaction would be a buying opportunity. He expects the rupee to stabilise, remains bullish on domestic cyclicals like autos, cement and capital goods, but stays cautious on smallcaps, midcaps, IPO listings and consumer-tech due to valuation risks.

title: Nifty poised for 11% returns in CY26, says BofA, explains why FIIs may return next year
description: BofA expects Nifty to deliver up to 11.4% returns by CY26 as earnings cuts ease, growth prospects improve and FII outflows may reverse. Largecaps are likely to outperform, while SMIDs offer selective opportunities but face sharper downside risks.

title: Smallcap Shock: 9 firms post strong earnings, but stocks crash up to 68% in just 2 months
description: Despite robust margins, nine high-performing smallcap stocks have plunged 20%–68% since October, underscoring that strong earnings don’t always drive share prices.

title: Bajaj Housing Finance shares slide 10% in 5 days. What’s spooking investors?
description: Bajaj Housing Finance shares have plunged nearly 10% in five days, sliding toward their IPO price as a large promoter stake sale spooked investors. The stock is down 35% from its December peak despite solid financial performance, raising concerns of further supply pressure.

title: Jayesh Mehta flags relentless FPI outflows as key driver of rupee weakness
description: The Indian rupee is facing pressure from significant foreign portfolio outflows.  Other factors like IPOs and rising gold imports are also increasing dollar demand.  The Reserve Bank of India is managing the currency's movement, acting as a speed breaker.  Global rate shifts are influencing corporate borrowing.  The rupee's future depends on global flows and external factors.

title: NephroPlus' Rs 871-cr IPO to open on Dec 10; sets price band at Rs 438-460/share
description: Dialysis services provider Nephrocare Health Services Ltd, known for its brand NephroPlus, on Thursday announced a price band of Rs 438-460 per share for its upcoming Initial Public Offering (IPO), valuing the company at over Rs 4,600 crore.

title: Euro zone government bond yields edge up, await US data
description: Euro zone government bond yields edged higher on Thursday, tracking U.S. Treasuries, as investors focused on the Federal Reserve's policy outlook ahead of key U.S. jobs data later in the day.

title: Steel cycle weak, but JSW–JFE deal strengthens balance sheet and future margins: Parag Thakkar
description: JSW Steel’s JFE partnership is a “game changer”, says Fort Capital’s Parag Thakkar, as the deal cuts debt by ₹37,250 crore and strengthens long-term expansion plans. Thakkar also sees PSU bank corrections as strong buying opportunities, led by robust credit growth and low-cost deposits. He remains bullish on India’s economic outlook and cautious on over-heated defence stocks.

title: Rupee under pressure, but “not a panic situation yet, says Abhishek Goenka
description: The Indian rupee's slide towards 90 has sparked market speculation, with experts suggesting it's seeking equilibrium due to unfavorable current and capital accounts. While short-term dips to 90.5-91 are possible, fundamentals point to a medium-term recovery towards 88, indicating potential undervaluation.

title: Meesho GMP hints at 45% listing pop, issue sees over 3 times subscription on Day 2. Should you bid?
description: Meesho’s ₹5,421 crore IPO has seen strong demand, subscribed over 3 times by Day 2, led by robust retail participation. Grey market trends point to a potential 40% listing premium, boosting expectations for one of the year’s most anticipated market debuts.

title: Global markets brace for Central Bank signals as Fed rate cut bets strengthen
description: Markets anticipate a US Federal Reserve rate cut next week, with equities and bonds showing enthusiasm.  Gold and oil are seen as attractive investments due to supportive fundamentals and global economic momentum.  Currency movements, particularly the yen and rupee, will significantly influence equity market performance, with stability crucial for new highs.

title: Bond investors voice unease over potential Hassett-led rate cuts
description: Bond investors have raised concerns that Kevin Hassett, a leading contender to replace Jerome Powell, may push for aggressive rate cuts aligned with President Trump’s preferences. Treasury officials were briefed by major Wall Street players, who worry Hassett could prioritise political objectives over market stability and the Fed’s inflation mandate.

title: Japan's 30-year bond yields rise to record as auction tests demand
description: Japanese government bonds saw record-high yields on 30-year debt, reaching 3.445%, amid plans for massive stimulus. Despite concerns over rising yields, an auction for these bonds attracted strong investor demand. Analysts suggest this reflects a belief that interest rate hikes might be nearing their peak, potentially flattening the yield curve.

title: Brookfield India REIT lines up debut bond issue in December
description: Brookfield India Real Estate Trust is set to launch its debut bond issue this month, aiming to raise 35 billion rupees through 3-year and 5-year bonds. The funds will support the REIT's acquisition of Ecoworld, a 48-acre office campus in Bengaluru. This move follows a trend of Indian REITs and InvITs tapping the bond market for financing.

title: Market poised for consolidation through December as FIIs go quiet, says Sunil Subramaniam
description: Market expert Sunil Subramaniam anticipates a quiet December for equities. He believes a significant recovery is unlikely this month, with a positive bias expected. Foreign institutional investors are booking profits and taking vacations. Domestic institutional investors are building cash. A potential RBI rate cut could offer a brief trigger.

title: India's largest private lender sees rupee falling to 92 in absence of quick US trade deal
description: Uncertainty surrounding a U.S.-India trade deal is driving rupee volatility, with the currency potentially falling to 92 per dollar if an agreement is delayed. The rupee has already hit an all-time low, becoming Asia's worst performer due to a widening trade gap and weak investment flows.

title: India bonds dip as sliding rupee, policy unease bite
description: Indian government bonds are experiencing a downturn, with yields climbing as the rupee weakens and policy uncertainty looms. Despite robust economic growth and low inflation, traders are hesitant ahead of the central bank's decision. The Reserve Bank of India's liquidity operations are adding to market confusion, leaving investors awaiting clear signals on future rate cuts and liquidity management.

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum rally to two-week highs as strong Fed rate-cut expectations lift risk sentiment
description: Bitcoin and Ethereum climbed to two-week highs as strong expectations of a Fed rate cut boosted risk sentiment. BTC hovered near $93,400 while ETH crossed $3,200. Analysts said softer U.S. data, improving liquidity and renewed ETF inflows supported the rebound, though leverage remains muted amid recent liquidation-driven caution.

title: Gold prices hold near Rs 1.30 lakh as traders brace for a Fed rate cut. Is a breakout above Rs 1.31 lakh next?
description: Gold hovered near Rs 1.30 lakh as traders awaited next week’s U.S. Fed meeting, with expectations of a rate cut keeping global prices firm above $4,200. Weak U.S. payroll data and a soft dollar supported bullion, while analysts said a dovish Fed could trigger a breakout above Rs 1.31 lakh.

title: Rupee sinks to 90.41 vs USD; economy continues to power on: Piyush Goyal
Big tech’s AI push and M&A revival set to drive surge in investment-grade debt issuance in 2026
description: Investment-grade debt issuance is set to surge in 2026 as Big Tech accelerates AI infrastructure spending and M&A activity rebounds. Top U.S. tech firms may require up to $100 billion in funding, while a swelling pipeline of corporate deals and renewed private-equity confidence is expected to further boost bond market activity.

title: Corona Remedies IPO opens next week: GMP among 10 things to know before subscription
description: Corona Remedies is launching its Rs 655 crore IPO next week. The Gujarat-based pharmaceutical firm is offering 100% of its shares. The grey market premium indicates a potential 29% upside. Investors can subscribe from December 8 to 10. The company has strong financial growth and high return ratios. Shares will list on NSE and BSE.

title: Rupee’s slide raises inflation risk, clouds rate cut hopes. What’s next for rate-sensitive sectors?
description: The rupee’s drop past 90 per dollar has shaken markets and dragged equities lower, with rate-sensitive sectors hit hardest. Despite strong GDP growth, the currency’s near 5% depreciation this year makes it the worst performer among major EM peers and has revived inflation concerns. Analysts warn that continued weakness could limit the RBI’s scope for further rate cuts.

title: PSU banks still offer tactical upside; midcaps still justified at premium, says JPMorgan’s Rajiv Batra
description: JPMorgan’s Rajiv Batra says PSU banks remain a top tactical bet despite recent volatility, with strong credit growth, tech upgrades, and policy support set to drive re-rating. FIIs may return as India’s growth, earnings, and reforms strengthen. He expects nominal GDP to rise, supporting 13–14% earnings growth and further upside in midcaps if momentum holds.

title: Trump’s Fed choice intensifies pressure on Treasury Secretary Bessent
description: President Donald Trump is intensely focused on lowering interest rates. He has tasked Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent with finding a new Federal Reserve chair. Trump wants swift rate cuts to boost the economy. The selection process is crucial, with potential candidates signaling willingness to align with Trump's agenda. The chosen nominee faces pressure to deliver.

title: Vidya Wires IPO Day 2: GMP trends, strong subscription. Should you apply?
description: Vidya Wires IPO: In the grey market, the IPO is quoting a ₹5 premium — about 9.6% above the upper price band — suggesting a possible listing near ₹57 per share. Investor sentiment remains upbeat, though the premium has eased from 11.54% earlier.

title: Aequs IPO Day 2: GMP suggest 37% listing upside, heavy demand. Is it worth applying?
description: Aequs’ IPO saw strong Day 1 demand, getting subscribed 3.42 times, with retail bids soaring past 11 times. The grey market premium suggests a 37% listing upside, indicating a possible debut near Rs 170. Despite recent losses, analysts cite strong aerospace integration, high entry barriers, and attractive valuations as key positives.

title: Flight disruptions drag IndiGo 3% lower, stock slips for 5th straight session
description: IndiGo operator InterGlobe Aviation’s shares fell sharply after widespread flight disruptions crippled operations for two days, prompting a public apology from the airline. A mix of tech glitches, winter schedule changes, adverse weather, congestion, and new crew rostering rules hit punctuality, leading IndiGo to recalibrate schedules to stabilise operations over the next 48 hours.

title: 15 IPOs to track in 8 days. GMPs hint at up to 41% listing gains for investors
description: A surge of 15 IPOs is capturing investor attention, with some already seeing strong subscription. Grey market premiums indicate potential listing gains of up to 41% for select issues, driven by brand strength and sector momentum. While some offerings show robust early interest, others are awaiting clearer market signals.

title: The way it's going, will Rupee breach the 100 mark sooner or later?
description: India's rupee has fallen to a record low against the dollar, raising concerns about a potential slide to 100. This depreciation is driven by weaker exports, foreign outflows, and global dollar strength. While policymakers remain measured, analysts suggest a breach of 100 is possible under specific negative scenarios, though not the base case.

title: Pine Labs shares in focus as fintech posts first quarterly profit since listing
description: Pine Labs shares: Pine Labs returned to profit in Q2FY26 with ₹6 crore in net earnings — its strongest performance yet and a turnaround from last year’s loss — alongside a 25% sequential growth in profit after tax.

title: Vodafone Idea among five stocks flashing bullish signals
description: Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it signals strong buying pressure throughout the session.

title: Sensex slips 100 pts, Nifty below 26,000 amid heavy FPI selling, weak rupee
description: Indian stocks opened lower on Thursday, extending a losing streak to a fifth session as foreign investors resumed heavy selling and the rupee hit a fresh record low. Investors are exercising caution ahead of the Reserve Bank of India's policy decision and guidance due Friday. The Sensex and Nifty both slipped in early trading.

title: ICICI Bank, Swiggy and six others show bullish RSI upswing
description: “RSI trending up” indicates that the Relative Strength Index (RSI) is rising, suggesting strengthening momentum in the stock’s price.

title: Foreigners net buyers of Japanese stocks as bets of Fed rate cut ease tech valuation worries
description: Foreign investors showed strong interest in Japanese stocks and bonds. They purchased technology and banking shares, anticipating Federal Reserve rate cuts and potential Bank of Japan rate hikes. This influx boosted Japanese equities, which are expected to see robust profit growth next year. Japanese investors, meanwhile, bought foreign stocks but sold foreign bonds.

title: Biocon shares in focus ahead of board meeting, fundraising plans
description: Biocon shares: Biocon’s Board will meet on Saturday, December 6, 2025, to decide on key proposals that could shape its growth and shareholder value. A major agenda item is a potential investment in its unlisted arm, Biocon Biologics either through cash or preferential allotment to boost its stake and support long-term expansion.

title: Corona Remedies IPO: From key dates to offer details; here are 10 things to know from RHP
description: Corona Remedies IPO: Pharmaceutical firm, Corona Remedies, is set to open its public issue for bidding on 8 December 2025 with aims to raise funds from the stock market through a OFS component. Here are 10 key things you should know.&nbsp;

title: Sovereign Gold Bond scheme 2017-18 delivers over 41% CAGR to investors; redemption date today — check details
description: Sovereign Gold Bonds issued under SGB 2017-18 Series-X are repayable on the expiration of eight years from the date of issue, i.e., 4 December 2017.

title: Speb Adhesives IPO allotment date likely today. GMP, steps to check share allotment status online on NSE, MUFG Intime
description: Speb Adhesives IPO allotment is expected today, December 04. The IPO, worth  ₹33.73 crore, was oversubscribed 2.34 times. Retail investors can check their allotment status on NSE's website or through MUFG Intime India. Refunds for unsuccessful applicants will begin on December 05, 2025.

title: IPO 2025: Out of  ₹1.21 lakh crore raised through 81 mainboard issues in 10 months, promoters galloped  ₹39,700 crore
description: The Indian IPO market remained robust in 2025, with 81 issues raising  ₹1,21,042 crore. Strong demand from retail and foreign investors contributed to this surge, even as market volatility persisted, positioning India as a top global player.

title: Markets have turned, 2026 will be ‘very exciting’ for Indian equities, says Ridham Desai
description: While the world has been in a ferocious bull market, India has been the outlier. But the country's relative performance has already turned in November, says Morgan Stanley managing director Ridham Desai at Hindustan Times Leadership Summit 2025.

title: Multibagger small-cap stock Diamond Power to be in focus on Friday on securing  ₹747 cr order from Adani Green Energy
description: Diamond Power Infrastructure shares are expected to gain investor interest on Friday after winning an order from Adani Green Energy for cable supply worth  ₹747.64 crore. The company has a market cap of  ₹7,538 crore and has shown substantial growth in the last two years.

title: Crude oil prices extend gains; Brent hits $63, WTI nears $60 after Ukraine strike on Russian oil pipeline
description: Crude prices rose on December 4, with Brent crude at $63 and WTI at $59.45, following Ukrainian attacks on Russian oil supplies. Despite gains, weak demand and rising US inventories capped prices, while Fitch Ratings revised oil price forecasts downward due to oversupply concerns.

title: Indian stock market poised for a rebound in 2026; slowdown in global growth biggest risk for India: Ridham Desai
description: Ridham Desai of Morgan Stanley India forecasts a potential rebound for the Indian stock market in 2026, driven by strong macro factors and earnings growth. However, he warns that a global slowdown remains the biggest risk.&nbsp;

title: AI has pushed the stock market to record highs. Why the economy could drag it down.
description: Stocks don’t seem know where to head, thanks to mixed economic data.

title: Top Gainers & Losers on Dec 04: Hindustan Copper, India Cements, Petronet LNG, Coforge, HFCL among top gainers
description: India's equity benchmarks closed higher on December 4, breaking a four-day losing streak, supported by tech, realty, and FMCG sectors. The Nifty 50 rose 0.18% to 26,033, while the Sensex gained 0.07% to 85,164. Caution persisted ahead of the RBI policy decision.

title: Sensex, Nifty 50 snap 4-day losing streak; mid, small-caps underperform— 10 key highlights from Indian stock market
description: The Sensex rose 159 points, or 0.19%, to close at 85,265.32, while the Nifty 50 ended at 26,033.75, up 48 points, or 0.18%. The BSE Midcap index fell 0.19% while the Smallcap index dropped 0.32%.

title: 350% rally in five years! Brewery stock declares fundraise, acquisition of subsidiary company at  ₹55 crore
description: On Thursday, brewery stock was trading marginally up at  ₹32.50 on NSE. The stock has been under pressure lately as it has descended by over 18.10% in the last month and 22% in six months.

title: RBI MPC meeting: Will a 25 bps rate cut spark a rally in the Indian stock market?
description: RBI MPC meeting: As the Reserve Bank of India considers a potential rate cut, experts suggest that retail liquidity constraints and market sentiment may dampen any positive reactions.

title: RBI Policy: Will MPC cut repo rate amid rising expectations of a US Fed rate cut?
description: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee is reviewing rates from December 3-5, with a decision on rate cuts expected tomorrow. Amid low inflation and strong growth, attention is on whether the RBI will take cues from a widely-expected US Fed rate cut next week.

title: ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund raises stake in LIC Housing Finance to 5.22%
description: LIC Housing Finance share price has fallen 5% in one month and has declined 9% in six months. The stock has dropped 14% over the past one year, while it has risen 39% in three years. LIC Housing Finance share price has rallied 57% in the past five years.

title: Will AIFs get to certify accredited investors? The decision is close
description: Under Sebi rules, only CDSL Ventures Ltd and NSDL Data Management Ltd can certify accredited investors, making it an arduous process for investors.

title: NSE SME stock jumps after this new product update. Check details
description: The small-cap stock has been under pressure lately as it has declined 2% in a month and 44% in last one year.

title: Dr Reddy’s pins hopes on semaglutide, but timely approvals hold the key
description: The company’s exports plan faces delays in approvals, with the pharmaceutical drugs directorate of Canada issuing it a notice of non-compliance in response to its application.

title: India-US Trade Deal: Coforge, Gokaldas Exports, Balkrishna Industries, among seven stocks seen as top beneficiaries
description: India-US Trade Deal: Pankaj Pandey of ICICI Securities believes that the expected rollback of US tariffs to a competitive level will put an end to business uncertainty, opening up trade between the two nations and instantly unlocking the delayed volumes

title: RBI MPC meeting: Check date, time, expectations, other details about upcoming announcement?
description: The RBI’s December meeting, set for this week, is in sharp market focus, with many anticipating that the central bank will continue moving gradually toward a more dovish policy stance.

title: AMFI rejig countdown: IPO stars prepare to topple the titans
description: Amfi’s January stock recategorization—expected to be announced in the first week of January and effective 1 February 2026—could see a new guard take over the large-cap roster.

title: Luxury Time IPO sails through on first day amid retail, NII demand; check GMP, issue details, more
description: Luxury Time IPO launched on December 4, with a price band of  ₹78 to  ₹82. The offering includes fresh issuance and an offer for sale, aiming to raise funds for new outlets and working capital. Subscription status shows strong demand among retail and institutional investors.

title: Clear Secured Services IPO allotment date likely today. GMP, steps to check share allotment status online for SME IPO
description: Clear Secured Services IPO allotment date is likely today, December 4. Investors can check Clear Secured Services IPO allotment status online through the websites of NSE and the IPO registrar. Bigshare Services is the Clear Secured Services IPO registrar.

title: Coromandel’s aggressive capex could reduce earnings volatility. Can it deliver?
description: Coromandel International is doubling down on fertilizers and crop protection with a  ₹4,000–5,000 crore capex plan aimed at lifting margins, stabilizing earnings and reducing dependence on volatile raw materials.

title: Mid-cap banks are back in favour. But only a few will ride the next rally.
description: Mid-cap banks are emerging as prime beneficiaries of the next credit upcycle, backed by stronger MSME and retail demand. But the real upside may be confined to a handful

title: Ravelcare IPO allotment likely today: GMP, steps to check SME IPO allotment status on BSE, registrar website
description: Investors can check Ravelcare IPO share allotment status online via the registrar's site or BSE. The IPO, which opened for subscription on December 1, was oversubscribed 438 times. Shares are expected to list on December 8 with a strong premium indicated.

title: Putin India visit: Experts see these 3 factors dominating India-Russia Annual Summit, 2 PSU stocks to benefit
description: Putin's India visit: Russian President Vladimir Putin is visiting India for the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit, focusing on enhancing trade and partnership&nbsp;

title: 450% rise in YTD! Multibagger small-cap stock hits upper circuit after this business update
description: Spice Lounge Food Works share price has given multibagger returns by surging over 137.62% in just six months, 454.29% in terms of year-to-date (YTD) and 896% in the last one year.

title: Why did Hindustan Copper, SAIL and other metal stocks gain up to 6.6%? Key reasons explained
description: Hindustan Copper jumped 6.6% to the day’s high of  ₹361.80 apiece, while Vedanta, Adani Enterprises, National Aluminium, SAIL, NMDC, and Hindalco Industries also traded with gains in the range of 0.50% to 1.3%.

title: Solar, EV stock Servotech Power Systems rises over 9%. Do you own?
description: Servotech Renewable Power System stock rose over 9% during Thursday's trading, despite hitting a 52-week low. The company reported an 88.24% drop in net profit and announced a  ₹74 crore rooftop solar initiative under PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana.

title: Hindustan Unilever demerger record date tomorrow. Last day to buy shares stock of combined entity
description: HUL demerger record date is December 5, Friday. Hence, today, December 4, is the last trading day for HUL as a combined entity. Shareholders holding HUL shares as of the record date will be entitled to receive equity shares of the demerged entity.

title: Indias largest private lender sees rupee falling to 92 in absence of quick US trade deal
description: INDIA-MARKETS/RUPEE (PIX):India's largest private lender sees rupee falling to 92 in absence of quick US trade deal

title: Astron Multigrain IPO allotment in focus: GMP, steps to check share allotment status online for SME IPO
description: Astron Multigrain's SME stock is expected to see a muted listing on December 8, as the grey market premium is nil. The IPO, which had a lukewarm response, was subscribed 1.22 times, with retail oversubscribed 1.94 times.

title: Pine Labs shares rose over 2% after Q2 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?
description: Pine Labs shares gained 2.5% after announcing a  ₹6 crore profit for Q2 FY26, a recovery from last year's loss. Revenue rose 18% to  ₹650 crore, with EBITDA up 62%. The stock remains under pressure from competitive market conditions.

title: IT gains push Indian benchmark shares higher; rupee hits all-time low
description: INDIA-STOCKS/:INDIA STOCKS-IT gains push Indian benchmark shares higher; rupee hits all-time low
